intro: Galium parisiense var. tenuicaule, commonly known as slender wood-socket, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial characterized by its slender, erect stems and opposite, simple leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and ecological role in supporting insect life make it a notable species in its native range.
